## Research Question 2

```{r}
#| label: fig-bar-chart
#| fig-cap: "Political Knowledge Scores by Gender."
#| fig-cap-location: top # APA 7th (Quarto's default is bottom)
#| fig-alt: "A bar chart showing that mean political knowledge was higher for participants identifying as Male than for those identifying as Female."
#| 
#| # --- Figure Note ---
#| # Quarto's `apa-pdf` format doesn't have a `fig-note` chunk option
#| # like it does for tables (`tbl-note`).
#| # Instead, you add the Figure Note manually in the text block
#| # immediately AFTER the figure chunk.

# --- Dummy Code for a ggplot2 Figure ---
cleaned_data |>
  filter(gender %in% c("Male", "Female")) |> # Example filter
  ggplot(aes(x = gender, y = political_knowledge, fill = gender)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "summary", fun = "mean", position = "dodge") +
  geom_errorbar(stat = "summary", fun.data = "mean_cl_normal", width = 0.2) +
  labs(y = "Political Knowledge Score (0-10)", x = "Gender") +
  theme_classic(base_size = 12) +
  theme(legend.position = "none") # Remove legend as x-axis is clear
```

*Note.* This figure displays the mean political knowledge scores for male and female participants. [cite\_start]Error bars represent 95% confidence intervals.
